court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT
outcome: Petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 5 in C.C.No.776 of 2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrates Court, Malappuram, which has arisen from Crime No.343 of 2016 of the Vengara Police Station, registered
full_text: PL Biz a A 2018/KER/734 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 8TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 18TH POUSHA, 1939 Cr1.MC.No. 8661 of 2017 cc 776/2017 JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, MALAPPURAM CRIME NO. 343/2016 OF VENGARA POLICE STATION , MALAPPURAM PETITIONER (S)/ACCUSED 1 TO 5 1 ABDUL SAMAD, AGED 49 YEARS, S/O.AHMED KUTTY, KANNETH HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. 2 NAJEEB C., AGED 40 YEARS, S/O.POKKER, CHEMBALA HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. 3 MUHAMMED BASHEER, AGED 41 YEARS, S/O.KUCHIMUHAMMED, PARANGODATH HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. 4 RASHEED , AGED 31 YEARS, S/O.KUNCHI MUHAMMED, PARANGODATH HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. 5 ABOOBACKER @ SIDEEQUE, AGED 43 YEARS, S/O.KUNCHEEDU, UTHENMELE THADATHIL HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. BY ADV.SRI.P.K.MOHAMED JAMEEL RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANTS : 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031. 2. SHAFEEQUE, AGED 28 YEARS, S/O.KUCHUMOHAMMED, CHEMBAN HOUSE, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., KANNAMANGALAM, VENGARA, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT.676304. 3. UNNIKRISHNAN, AGED 27 YEARS, S/O.CHOOLAN, KAPRATTUPADIKKAL HOUSE, THADATHIPPARA, KILINAKODE, CHERUR P.O., KANNAMANGALAM, VENGARA, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT.676304. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI ALEX M THOMBRA R2,R3 BY ADV. SRI.JINU JOSEPH THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 08-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: K.V. plane Bz 2 ae 2018/KER/734 Cr1.MC.No. 8661 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.343/2016 OF VENGARA POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A2 ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT OF 2ND RESPONDENT. ANNEXURE A3 ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT OF 3RD RESPONDENT. RESPONDENTS ANNEXURES : /TRUE COPY/ K.V. P.S.TO JUDGE B.KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 8" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 5 in C.C.No.776 of 2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrates Court, Malappuram, which has arisen from Crime No.343 of 2016 of the Vengara Police Station, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324, 294(b) and 506(ii) IPC read with Section 149 IPC. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. The defacto complainant and the other affected person have filed Annexure-A2 and Annexure-A3 affidavits affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between them and the petitioners and they have no complaints against the Bae BPAaeie 2018/KER/734 Crl.M.C.No.8661 of 2017 2 petitioners. Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, Annexure-Al Final Report and all further proceedings in C.C.No.776 of 2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrates Court, Malappuram, which has arisen from Crime No.343 of 2016 of the Vengara Police Station, as against the petitioners, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-Al Final Report and all further proceedings in C.C.No.776 of 2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrates Court, Malappuram, which has arisen from Crime No.343 of 2016 of the Vengara Police Station, as against the petitioners, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE DSV/8/1/18 H True Copy // P.A.To Judge
